markdownRemark.html:
Problem

Query the two cities in STATION with the shortest and longest CITY names, as well as their respective lengths (i.e.: number of characters in the name). If there is more than one smallest or largest city, choose the one that comes first when ordered alphabetically. The STATION table is described as follows:

where LAT_N is the northern latitude and LONG_W is the western longitude.

Sample Input For example, CITY has four entries: DEF, ABC, PQRS and WXY.

Sample Output

ABC 3
PQRS 4

Explanation When ordered alphabetically, the CITY names are listed as ABC, DEF, PQRS, and WXY, with lengths 3,3,4, and 3 . The longest name is PQRS, but there are 3 options for shortest named city. Choose ABC, because it comes first alphabetically.

Note You can write two separate queries to get the desired output. It need not be a single query.

Solution

SELECT CITY, LENGTH(CITY) 
FROM (SELECT CITY 
      FROM STATION 
      ORDER BY LENGTH(CITY), CITY ASC) 
WHERE ROWNUM = 1; 

SELECT CITY, LENGTH(CITY) 
FROM (SELECT CITY 
      FROM STATION 
      ORDER BY LENGTH(CITY) DESC) 
WHERE ROWNUM = 1;

Problem link
